name: subject
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the thing that is being discussed, considered, or studied
trans_examp.trans_cn: （讨论、考虑或研究的）主题，话题；问题；题目

example.eg: Our subject for discussion is homelessness.
example.egtrans: 我们讨论的话题是无家可归问题。

example.eg: She has made a series of documentaries on the subject of family relationships.
example.egtrans: 她拍摄了一系列以家庭关系为题材的纪录片。

example.eg: The guest lecturer took as her subject (= decided to speak about) "punishment and imprisonment in modern society".
example.egtrans: 特邀演讲人演讲的题目是“现代社会的刑罚与监禁”。

example.eg: The number of planes flying over the town has been the subject of (= has caused) concern since last summer.
example.egtrans: 自去年夏天开始，从小镇上空飞过的飞机数量一直让人们忐忑不安。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of knowledge that is studied in school, college, or university
trans_examp.trans_cn: （中小学或大学的）学科；科目；专业

example.eg: My favourite subjects at school were history and English.
example.egtrans: 上学时我最喜欢的科目是历史和地理。

example.eg: Her subject (= special area of study) is low-temperature physics.
example.egtrans: 她的专业是低温物理学。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start talking about a different subject

example.eg: I'd tried to explain the situation, but he just changed the subject.
example.egtrans: 我想把情况解释清楚，他却岔开了话题。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, thing, or situation that is written about in a book, article, etc. or shown in a picture, etc.

example.eg: The mill by the bridge was the subject of an unfinished painting by J. M. W. Turner.
example.egtrans: 桥边磨坊是特纳一副未完成油画的主题。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the person or thing that performs the action of a verb, or is joined to a description by a verb

example.eg: "Bob" is the subject of the sentence "Bob threw the ball."
example.egtrans: Bob 是句子 Bob threw the ball 的主语。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who lives in or who has the right to live in a particular country, especially a country with a king or queen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指君主制国家的）臣民，国民

name: subject
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to defeat people or a country and then control them against their wishes and limit their freedom

example.eg: The invaders quickly subjected the local tribes.
example.egtrans: 入侵者很快就征服了当地的部落。

name: subject
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have or experience a particular thing, especially something unpleasant

example.eg: Cars are subject to a high domestic tax.
example.egtrans: 买汽车要交很高的国内税。

example.eg: In recent years, she has been subject to attacks of depression.
example.egtrans: 近年来，她一直饱受抑郁症的折磨。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: only able to happen if something else happens

example.eg: We plan to go on Wednesday, subject to your approval.
example.egtrans: 如果你同意，我们打算周三走。

example.eg: Moving all the books should not take long, subject to there being (= if there are) enough helpers.
example.egtrans: 如果有足够的人手，把所有的书都搬走花不了多少时间。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: under the political control of another country or state
